JobListing.ShortDescription: Digger Operator required for immediate start!

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: North Shore Location- No more city traffic!
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Grow your career in Civil Construction

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Excavator/Digger Operator

• Great Pay Rates!
• Great company
• Good gear

Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market. We are specialists in civil infrastructure, construction and mining, and recruit for opportunities in NZ, Australia and even further abroad.

We are seeking a skilled, reliable Operator, who has experience operating excavators.

This role is not for the faint hearted, it is a physically demanding role that will give you the opportunity to further develop your career in the Civil construction industry. Not only will you be operating multiple machines but you will also be assisting on the ground as and when required.

Typically building Retaining Walls on large scale Civil works projects, our ideal candidate will have experience in the following:

• Drilling with Pendulum type drill rigs
• Excavating of footings
• Bulk Backfilling
• Compaction knowledge
• Machine Maintenance abilities

In order to be considered for this role you must have:

• Current Class 2 driver’s license
• Wheels Tracks and Rollers endorsed
• Excellent verbal communication skills
• Carry out regular maintenance of plant
• Team Player
• Reliable & punctual

What’s in it for you:

• Competitive rates of pay
• Optional Vehicle, phone & fuel neg
• Training opportunities

If this sounds like you, apply online today!!

For more information on the role including duties, hours and rates of pay, contact Fern on 09 969 1028 or email your CV to fern.d@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Grader Operator- great opportunity to join a awesome team!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Grader operator


The Company

Our Auckland based company has a huge workload on over the foreseeable future and they are looking for a final trim grader operator to join their outstanding team on a permanent basis.

What we’re looking for:

  • Ideally a minimum of 10 years in the industry on a grader.
  • Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality workmanship
  • Good problem solving skills
  • Able to work with minimal supervision and as part of a crew
  • Willing to learn and have a strong work ethic
  • Be physically fit
  • Be a genuine team player

We seek applicants with a positive attitude towards maintaining a safe working environment and motivated to helping our client achieve Zero Harm.

Supervisory Level:

• 10 years final trim Grader experience
• Proven ability to lead a crew and run jobs
• GPS experience a bonus but not essential
• Ability to operate other various machinery Eg: Digger, Bully (again not essential)

If this sounds like you and you would like to apply for this role or for more information please contact Fern at Stellar Workforce on 09 969 1028 or email your CV to fern.d@stellarworkforce.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Experienced Digger Operators needed for immediate start!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market in 2016.

Our clients want us to find the best excavator operators we can! With drainage projects increasing, we want to hear from skilled excavator operators with drainage experience. 

If you can say yes to the following then we want to hear from you.

  • Class 1, WTR, with Class 2 advantageous
  • Pipe installation and/or pipe renewal projects
  • Deep drainage experience up to 6m
  • Digging inside trench shields with and without spotter assistance
  • Digging around services in and above the ground
  • Able to dig to height and levels
  • Final trim experience advantageous
  • Trenching and backfilling
  • Experience on machines up to 20 tonne
  • Ability to assist with ground works


If your skills and experience are described in the above, then Stellar want to hear from you.

You will also have:

  • The right to work in New Zealand
  • A good level of physical fitness
  • Demonstrate sound Health and Safety practices

 

For further information about this role or to discuss other positions on offer, please contact Fern Dickinson on 09 969 1028 or email fern.d@stellarworkforce.co.nz

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Senior Structural Engineer with or working towards **CPENG with a minimum of 6+ years’ experience and have strong proficiency with ETABS, SpaceGASS
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Structural Design Engineers, are you on track with your 5 year plan?
The dreaded 5 year plan, your ideological path to success over the next 5 years but is your current company going to help you achieve this? Whether it’s career path, team culture, progression and of course money, all of these factor in to your success, and your enjoyment of the role, but do you have what you want?

Stellar has partnered with an emerging consultancy who have one goal in mind…***GROWTH. With strong fundamentals and family ideals within the company who value and implement your input, this is a real opportunity for a Senior Structural Engineer with or working towards **CPENG with a minimum of 6+ years’ experience and have strong proficiency with ETABS, SpaceGASS.

Your responsibilities will be to manage structural design of projects varying in size from medium to large, have strong ability and confidence liaising with varying professionals from: Clients, Contractors to Architects, as well as advising during design and construction stage on various projects.

What this company will offer you:
• Clear supported career progression
• Exciting projects
• Sense of value and appreciation
• No corporate politics

What we require from you:

• CPENG or working towards your Chartership
• New Zealand Experiance
• 6+ years Structural Design Experience
• Client facing skills
• Strong proficiency with ETABS and SpaceGass.
• Desire to grow your career

So if your plan needs help, maybe you feel undervalued, tired of the corporate world, or just fancy a change I am here to help. If your skills match above please apply directly with your CV to adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz I must implore that before you apply you must have all documentation to work in New Zealand, and that New Zealand experience is preferred. Take that 1st step today and get in touch, and let’s discuss your next move.


Thank you for your time.

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
SK917023A

JobListing.ShortDescription: TIER 1 Builder / Terrific Major Building Development / Coordinate Services Installation Subbies / Job Security / CIRCA $130-140K + Super / Start ASAP!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Tier 1 Commercial Builder, High Performance Team
  • Major Perth Metro Commercial Project, START ASAP!
  • Superb Salary Package (CIRCA $140K + super)

Our client is a Tier 1 commercial building company in Perth that has a current requirement for a Services Supervisor to join their highly professional site construction team. This role will specifically involve coordination and management of services subcontractors on site during construction of a large multi-level commercial building development.

This is a superb position that will provide long term job security on a major project. This building project is valued in excess of $100m and therefore we are seeking an experienced Services Supervisor who has recently coordinated all building services installations on similar commercial building projects in Perth for prominent Tier 1 or 2 builders.

As Services Supervisor you will be responsible for interpreting services design drawings and specifications, then coordinating and monitoring services subcontractors during installation of; Hydraulics, Electrical, Mechanical, Fire, ICT, Lifts, Acoustic, Lagging and Anti-vibration. It is essential that you are technically savvy on services installation and highly adept in programming these works on large scale commercial construction developments in order to drive the performance of subcontractors and meet key deadlines and deliverables. Your experience may have been gained on projects such as major hospitals, high rise buildings such as commercial office towers, hotels or similar building projects.

To be considered for this role you will ideally have the following qualifications, skills and experience:

  • 5+ years stable experience as a Services Supervisor in the commercial building sector with Tier 1&2 building companies in Perth
  • Recent experience on commercial building developments ($100m+) in Western Australia as a Services Supervisor
  • Recent experience coordinating and supervising subcontractors on installation of services on high rise projects including; Hydraulics, Electrical, Mechanical, Fire, ICT, Lifts installation, Acoustic, Lagging and Anti-vibration
  • Excellent ability to read and interpret services designs and specifications in conjunction with Arch documentation
  • Strong construction programming skills and ability to look ahead to plan for upcoming workload
  • Great communication skills with ability to contribute confidently during site meetings
  • Ability to coordinate and drive services trades to push program and achieve deliverables
  • Currently based in Perth with existing rights to live and work in Australia

As the successful Services Supervisor you will be offered a superb Perth based salary CIRCA $130-140K (+ super) which will be reflective of your skills and previous relevant experience.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number SA28302.

Consultant: Scott Alexander

Phone: 08 9422 2702

Email: scott@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Christchurch / $90k - $100k / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions /

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Christchurch - $90,000 - $100,000 + Private Use Company Vehicle
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz  

SK91353A

JobListing.ShortDescription: experienced and qualified contracts administrator

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Diverse Commercial Building Projects for projects over $30Mil
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: Respected Brisbane based Builder, Proud History of Success
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Exciting Career Prospects, Great salary + super

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Our client is a highly successful Brisbane based building company that has had a great opportunity come available for a career driven Contract Administrator to join their fast paced Brisbane team. This builder has strong local presence, a young vibrant culture, and a terrific history of successfully completing a broad range of commercial building projects around the $30Million plus range.


As Contract Administrator within this business you will work within a successful and vibrant team environment and undertake commercial and cost management duties for projects of various nature in the commercial building space. As a guide your projects will likely include schools, aged care, health care, defence, industrial, office buildings and mixed use developments. This company prides itself on hiring people to develop a long term career rather than gathering a new team per project.


You will be a “self-sufficient” Contract Administrator with a thorough understanding of pre and post award contracts administration tasks, coupled with great attention to detail. Within your role you will review tender documentation, prepare subcontractor documents, manage subcontractor packages and payments, variations and progress claims, prepare financial cost forecasts, monitor cash flow, budgeting, and prepare progress reports.


Ideally you will have the following qualifications and background as the successful applicant:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Quantity Surveying or Construction Management & Economics
  • 3-5 years stable experience as a Contract Administrator for commercial builders
  • Proficient using construction specific software
  • Great interpersonal skills, team oriented approach and good work ethic
  • Currently based in Brisbane with existing rights to live and work in Australia

An appealing remuneration package + super will be offered to attract the ideal Contract Administrator. If you are seeking an exciting career move get in touch today!

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number KS28319.

Consultant: Kate Szczurowski

Phone: 07 3009 9630

Email: kate.s@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Exciting opportunity to work for a local contractor who are one of the top performers in the market with a pipeline of work that speaks for itself
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Relocate to Christchurch, New Zealand

  • Christchurch based long term position
  • Senior position and responsibilities
  • Professional team that works together



If you are a Senior Quantity Surveyor looking for an opportunity to work with colleagues that are respected, knowledgeable and professional in their areas of specialism within the construction sector, and to have the opportunity to work with a company with a clear vision and head office based in Christchurch, then this is a position that you need to be aware of.

This is an autonomous role, with support and guidance from Senior Management when desired, where you will be responsible for your own portfolio of work in multimillion dollar commercial construction and public sector. You will have an opportunity to build and select your own team of Quantity Surveyors reporting into you, while you assist in the big picture winning and signing contracts on top of a very healthy pipeline of works already won and ready for you to take over.

Software, systems, and tools are already in place that you require to do your job successfully. You will work alongside a professional and experienced Project Manager becoming part of a close knit, non-corporate yet very qualified team, with a family feel.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Senior Liaison with all related design consultants and construction sub-contractors
  • Detailed pricing and scheduling of quantities
  • Evaluation, selection and negotiation of sub-contract tenders
  • Cost/budget management
  • Leadership and work allocation to Quantity Surveyor’s
  • Estimation


To be considered for this position you will have:

  • A relevant qualification
  • Must be based in Christchurch, nearby or thinking of relocation
  • 10 years + experience in Quantity Surveying
  • Working on projects $20M +

This is a genuine are rare opportunity due to growth. We are seeking long term skilled applicants with a passion for their field of work and commitment to Canterbury.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Calling all Plumbers!

Right now we are actively seeking Trade Qualified Plumbers, who are confident in all aspects of plumbing, to take on a variety of major commercial and domestic projects within the general vicinity of Christchurch.

Scope of work includes; Commercial Maintenance, New installs, Renovations, Upgrades maintenance from new housing, to light commercial work.

All applicants for this role will need;

  • At least 5 years industry experience
  • A minimum of 2 years’ experience in NZ
  • Trade Qualification (either in NZ or overseas) – to be a certifying plumber would be advantageous
  • To be currently registered/licensed with the Plumbers, Drainlayers and Gasfitters Board of NZ.
  • Have a solid understanding of the current New Zealand Plumbing Regulations, health and safety (HSE/OSH).
  • A clean full drivers licence (minimum of class 1,),
  • Your own reliable transport
  • Christchurch based, or be willing to relocate
  • To have a high standard or workmanship,
  • To be reliable and able to work unsupervised and
  • At least two referees that attest to your honesty, work ethic and drive.
     

Working as part of team is also important due to the critical timeframes involved in these projects.

Ideally you will be able to provide your own hand and power tools and a site safe card would benefit your application.

Stellar are looking for ambitious, capable and energetic people with a good dose of common sense to join our team. We work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we're only as good as our people, and we've been successfully growing over the past 7 years, partnering with skilled tradesmen and large organisations, because of it.

We offer the opportunity for career progression, the potential for permanent employment and work in a supportive environment. With Stellar Recruitment, you are more than just a number – we will work with you to ensure that the role you accept is the right fit for you – not just another job.

We are aware that wages don’t work for everyone, so also offer a contracting option with all invoices paid weekly – Whatever works for you!

Applicants should be aware that both our, and our clients Health and Safety Standards are very high and we reserve the right to conduct a drug test pre-employment as well as random alcohol and drug testing throughout employment.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Intermediate to Senior Civil Engineer for Emerging Consultancy with focus on sub divisions
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
3 months into 2016 Civil Engineers stick or twist?
Somehow we have blinked and we are now 3 months into 2016, the year has started quickly and in all accounts is looking to be exciting, busy and very prosperous, or is it? Incidentally what is the view like in your office? If you’re reading this at work I can only assume it’s pretty bleak.
Stellar have been busy forging and strengthening relationships and really delving and uncovering the goals or our clients and are very happy to be supporting this emerging client in growing on its existing high performance and healthy work life balance.
With Long established rock solid reputation and growing success built around its existing team, growth is now the word and this company is looking to bring the right staff in to the fold. With openings for intermediate to Senior Engineers, career plans are waiting for the right candidate who feels they want to pursue and develop their career further in to the management field. Every avenue is covered from soft skill training to freedom to express yourself. If you have an eye on the future there can only be one course of action, get in touch today.

What you will need
• 5+years design experience
• New Zealand Experience
• Strong Sub division experience
• Ability to liaise with clients
• Ambition to grow and develop

What this company will give you
• Great company culture
• Guided career path
• Annual Bonus
• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. At stellar we really believe in partnership and strong relationships and that only comes from listening, and finding out what you want. The best way to see your dreams come true is to voice them, if you match the above criteria then please email adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 09 9691029 and lets change the years forecast together. Your cards may have been dealt but that doesn’t mean this will be your hand for life, the dealer is now looking at you, It’s your turn what will it be? Stick or twist?

Engineering & Design Specialist

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Brisbane CBD location
• Competitive base and above market uncapped commissions
• Join our strong, vibrant and successful culture

About Stellar:
Stellar are committed to delivering the highest quality recruitment solutions to our clients and candidates. We build lasting partnerships with employers and offer job seekers life-changing career opportunities. Our high calibre team are driven by our vision to be the number one choice in global resources and infrastructure recruitment.

About the job:
An exciting opportunity is available for an experienced Recruitment Consultant to join our growing Brisbane team. This role will specialise in Supply Chain, Procurement and Logistics recruitment across Stellar’s diverse client base predominately within the oil & gas, resources and construction sectors.
Working closely with the existing team, you will continue to develop and maintain strong client and candidate partnerships by focusing on key business development initiatives. You will also partner with existing PSA’s and key clients to develop strategic recruitment plans.

About you:
To be successful in this role, it is essential that you be a high performing recruitment professional with a track record of results and desire to build long lasting relationships. The ideal candidate will possess a minimum of 2 years’ experience in recruitment with demonstrated market knowledge. You must have strong interpersonal and communication skills, a high level of initiative and team work skills and an ability to demonstrate in every way, our Stellar values; Leadership, Positivity and Greatness.

How you will be rewarded:
In return for high levels of drive and energy, as well as an honest and genuine approach to your work, we offer a, flexible and fun work environment, recognition and reward programs, health and wellbeing incentives, excellent earning potential and the prospect to work with a reputable and quickly expanding recruitment organisation.
We pride ourselves on our strong and vibrant culture that promotes and recognises high performers. So if you are looking for a career and not just a job, then this is the role and team for you.

Proactive mentor environment whilst mentoring others

In this role, you will play an integral part of the New Zealand team by delivering infrastructural engineering projects (roading and civil) on time, growing the South Island business through developing existing and new client relationships and mentor engineers with your technical and analytical expertise.

• At least 5+ years in the NZ Infrastructure sector - Roads or civil

• Strong understanding of NZ Standards (dynamic and seismic analysis)
• Strong technical ability across commercial build, bridge, infrastructure, water and power projects

• Very competitive remuneration package

Global engineering firm highly regarded for engineering projects
Lucrative remuneration package plus benefits and enviable culture

Due to continual growth and development this highly regarded global engineering firm is looking to expand the team by adding the experience of a highly experienced infrastructural Engineer with a diverse range of projects under their belt to lead their team. In this role, you will play an integral part of the New Zealand team by delivering infrastructural engineering projects (roading and civil) on time, growing the South Island business through developing existing and new client relationships and mentor engineers with your technical and analytical expertise.

You will report to a senior Director who possesses 20+ year’s experience and has a history of business growth, a highly regarded technical knowledge and a wealth of international experience. He is also passionate about continual improvement of himself and his team.

To be successful in this position you must possess the following:
• Ideally 10+ years post graduate Engineering experience
• At least 5+ years in the NZ Infrastructure sector - Roads or civil
• Tertiary qualifications in Engineering and CPeng
• Previous work experience within an engineering consultancy in NZ
• Strong understanding of NZ Standards (dynamic and seismic analysis)
• Strong technical ability across commercial build, bridge, infrastructure, water and power projects
• Proven ability to manage a team of professionals
• Preferred network of contacts within NZ
• Strong focus on professional development

In return for your experience, you will receive:
• Very competitive remuneration package
• Proactive mentor environment
• Senior member of a high performance team
• Responsibility for you team and results
• Opportunity for global engineering exposure
• Diversity of projects across the South island
• Family orientated culture and lifestyle benefits

So if you have the technical ability and passion for driving a business to achieve results as well as a history of successfully delivering projects, I urge you to apply.

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90k - $100k + Bonus / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions /

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Christchurch - $90,000 - $100,000 + Bonuses + Private Use Company Vehicle
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
On offer with Stellar Workforce is not just a job, but a career full of success and opportunities with a global brand.

  • Build lasting partnerships with our blue chip clients
  • Work with an innovative, motivated and passionate team of high performers
  • Partner with a reputable global brand experiencing significant local growth

About Stellar:
The Stellar team are committed to delivering the highest quality solutions to our clients and candidates. We build lasting partnerships with our blue chip clients and offer job seekers life-changing career opportunities.

Our high calibre team are driven by our vision to be the number one choice in global resources and infrastructure recruitment and labour and our core values; leadership, positivity and greatness.

About the job:
Due to our continued growth and several major contract wins, we have created a diverse client facing Business Development/Account Management role. Located in the Hunter Valley region and with scope to grow and truly make the role your own some of your key responsibilities will include

  • Being the key point of contact for Stellar Recruitment clients locally in the Hunter Valley across various workshops, mine and project sites.
  • Actively engaging and partnering with clients and candidates to promote and support continued growth of our labour hire workforce in the region.
  • Establishing and developing new client relationships
  • Facilitating regular on-site OH&S including toolbox talks, safety meetings and site inductions

About you:
To be successful in this role you will have

  • An understanding and previous exposure to the mining industry including OH&S
  • Relevant industry experience either in recruitment, account management which may include maintenance production related positions.
  • Proven ability to establish and build strong relationships and work autonomously
  • Excellent communication skills interpersonal and organisational and skills.

How you will be rewarded:
Along with a market competitive salary your package will also include a work vehicle, allowances, laptop and phone. You will also have access to our comprehensive employee benefits program including flexible working conditions and health and wellbeing initiatives.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Opportunity to work in a career position for a long standing reputable building contractor based in Otago, reporting into a Senior Quantity Surveyor,
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Live and work in the heart of NZ's premier outdoor adventure region

  • Attractive role with long-standing, reputable family firm

  • High-end architectural and commercial projects

We are currently looking for a Quantity Surveyor to work for a successful building contractor that has been in operation for over 50 years in Central Otago. As you will be working alongside an experienced and knowledgeable Quantity Surveyor, we are able to adapt the position to suite the level of experience that you have.

This positon will be based in Alexandra, where head office is located. This is in the heart of Pinot Noir country, and only an hour’s drive from Queenstown where any adventure, fine food, or scenic drive that your heart desires can be obtained and more!

You will be working for a locally owned and operated company that has a real focus on not only providing the best experience for its clients, but also for it employees.

Your responsibilities will include:
• Estimation
• Detailed pricing and scheduling of quantities
• Liaison with design consultants and construction sub-contractors
• Contract administration, cost-management, variations, payment claims
• Negotiations of sub-contractor pricing
• Site meetings

This company has a strong portfolio in Architectural, retail, public, rural, and historical projects where you will be able to gain invaluable project experience or utilise the expertise you have already obtained in more of a sole charge capacity.

This is a permanent, full time career appointment where you really will be able to live the work life balance dream. We are looking to fill this positon ASAP. JobListing.JobFullDescription:
- 2 year project, with ongoing work
- Established Company with routine and reliable pay
- Seeking a Senior Quantity Surveyor as well as a Junior QS OR Contract Administrator

We are currently working to secure a Senior Quantity Surveyor to work on a multi-million dollar project in Christchurch, scheduled for completion in 2018. You will be working for a large Australasian wide commercial plumbing and drainage operation, with a vast amount of experience in delivering large scale commercial build projects, including projects completed in Christchurch.

This is a very stable organisation with an experienced Estimation and Site Management team, which carry their own trade personal. You will be working very closely with council, engineers, designers, and the main contractor, alongside a Senior Site Manager leading this project. Your position comes with high responsibility and fast delivery expectations. Upon selection of the Senior Quantity Surveyors position we will be recruiting a support person for you in a Junior Quantity Surveyor OR Contract Administrator capacity.

Your duties as Senior Quantity Surveyor will include:

- Autonomous Q.S. duties and responsibilities
- All take-offs/pricing
- Handling all variations in high volume and cost
- Payment claims
- Supplier negotiations when required
- Site Meetings

To be considered for this position you:

- Must have New Zealand based experience working for a contractor on commercial builds $15 million plus
- Hold a relevant qualification and residency/appropriate visa
- Ideally be based in Christchurch or motivated to move here quickly

This is a permanent positon, but we are able to consider various employment models including contracted work. Remuneration is competitive and dependant on the applicant’s level of expertise.

If you are self-driven, like to work with a progressive company, and enjoy a fast-paced environment where you will be given whatever you need to get the job done, this this is a positon you need to apply for now. We are looking to fill this very exciting position ASAP.

Please call Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, if you would like to know more about this opportunity on 027 635 3330, or brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. Otherwise we look forward to viewing your application.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you passionate about the agricultural industry?
• Do you want a chance to progress your career as a diesel mechanic?
• Are you looking for a change in scenery?
• Do you want to work for a company that rewards their technicians?


A promising role has arisen for a Diesel Mechanic to work for one of the leaders in the Agricultural Equipment industry in New Zealand. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance, servicing and repair of a wide range of specialised tractors, telehandlers and bailers, as well as a range of axillary agricultural equipment in the workshop and out in the field. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression and career advancement (including international training) from within. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with training opportunities, state of the art work systems, leadership training from strong management teams and a competitive pay packet.

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience maintaining diesel equipment (preferably with an agricultural background) with trade certification while favourable is not essential.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite.
• Excellent diagnostic skills both using computer systems and visually.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• A strong ability to be a self-starter and get the job done.

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or perhaps you’re looking to back your passion for agricultural equipment- either way, this position could be the ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as work hours, location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

JobListing.JobTitle: Intermediate - Senior Civil Engineer land and site
JobListing.ShortDescription: Intermediate to Senior Civil Engineer for Emerging Consultancy with focus on sub divisions
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
3 months into 2016 Civil Engineers stick or twist?
Somehow we have blinked and we are now 3 months into 2016, the year has started quickly and in all accounts is looking to be exciting, busy and very prosperous, or is it? Incidentally what is the view like in your office? If you’re reading this at work I can only assume it’s pretty bleak.
Stellar have been busy forging and strengthening relationships and really delving and uncovering the goals or our clients and are very happy to be supporting this emerging client in growing on its existing high performance and healthy work life balance.
With Long established rock solid reputation and growing success built around its existing team, growth is now the word and this company is looking to bring the right staff in to the fold. With openings for intermediate to Senior Engineers, career plans are waiting for the right candidate who feels they want to pursue and develop their career further in to the management field. Every avenue is covered from soft skill training to freedom to express yourself. If you have an eye on the future there can only be one course of action, get in touch today.

What you will need
• 5+years design experience
• New Zealand Experience
• Strong Sub division experience
• Ability to liaise with clients
• Ambition to grow and develop

What this company will give you
• Great company culture
• Guided career path
• Annual Bonus
• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. At stellar we really believe in partnership and strong relationships and that only comes from listening, and finding out what you want. The best way to see your dreams come true is to voice them, if you match the above criteria then please email adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 09 9691029 and lets change the years forecast together. Your cards may have been dealt but that doesn’t mean this will be your hand for life, the dealer is now looking at you, It’s your turn what will it be? Stick or twist?
 

Adam Towler

In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance, servicing and repair of a wide range of specialised Tractors, Harvesters and Bailers, as well as a range of auxiliary agricultural equipment in the workshop and out in the field. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression and career advancement (including international training) from within. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with training opportunities, state of the art work systems, leadership training from strong management teams and a competitive pay packet. Relocation could be available for top notch candidates.

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience maintaining diesel equipment (preferably with an agricultural background) with trade certification while favourable is not essential.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite.
• Excellent diagnostic skills both using computer systems and visual fault finding skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• A strong ability to be a self-starter and get the job done.

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or you’re looking to back your passion for agricultural equipment- either way, this position could be the ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals.

To apply or to find out more details contact Richard on 08 9422 2726 or Richard.S@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly reputable WA Building Company / SOR Location, Avoid Traffic, On site parking/Start on Contract, Permanent options if you excel/CIRCA $70/hr
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Superb WA Building Company
  • South of the River Location, Avoid Traffic!
  • CIRCA $70/hr, Permanent Role Available!

Our client is an established and successful West Australian civil and building construction contractor that has an IMMEDIATE need to recruit a contract Estimator to join their experienced team based in Perth’s southern suburbs. There is a strong possibility this role will go permanent in time. This business delivers construction projects typically valued up to $5m which may include; commercial and industrial buildings (public and private sector), apartments, mixed use developments and minor civil infrastructure (earthworks and concrete).

Working for this company is rewarding. You’ll join a professional team with great leadership who are vastly experienced in the delivery of construction projects in Western Australia. They have a superb 40 year track record of successfully delivering high quality, safe projects under their ISO9001:2008 Quality accreditation and AS/NZS4801:2001 Safety accreditation.

This Estimator role will involve preparing pricing for a variety of projects involving insitu structures, brickwork and tilt panels, that may be metro based or remote projects in Western Australia. This initial 4 week contract position will therefore appeal to an Estimator seeking diverse project exposure, and increased responsibility and ownership over winning new projects for the business. The prospect of this role moving to a permanent position is extremely high for a candidate who excels in this role.

It is essential that applicants have previously worked as an Estimator for building companies pricing projects valued up to $5m-$10m in Western Australia. Your role will involve reading plans and interpreting specifications to accurately perform detailed take offs and prepare cost plans for new projects. You will also issue tender packages to suppliers and subcontractors.

To be considered for this role ideally you will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Construction Management & Economics, Quantity Surveying or Engineering
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as an Estimator for a commercial building company in WA
  • Proven ability to prepare “first principle” estimates on building/civil projects up to $10m
  • Previous success preparing successful tenders for public sector building developments.
  • Excellent computer literacy and ability to use Quest/Expert Estimation software or similar
  • A great attitude to work and a friendly disposition
  • Currently based in Perth with existing rights to live and work in Australia.

You will be offered a superb contract rate of CIRCA $70/hr as the successful candidate which will be tailored to your level of career experience to date. A permanent salary will be negotiated later if you excel in this contract role.

The company office is located in Perth’s southern suburbs so will suit a candidate based south of the river who wishes to avoid the daily grind of city traffic. This is an IMMEDIATE requirement so those able to start at short notice will be highly regarded.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number SA28688.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Front End Web Developer - Brisbane Based - Join one of Australia's fastest growing Tech Companies
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Brisbane Based Position
  • Successful and Growing Tech-Start Up
  • Great Company Culture and Team

Our business Stellar Technology has close ties to the growing and exciting Tech-Start up scene in Brisbane, Australia. There is a real buzz in the city and a lot of investment from both government and corporate in this space. With an increasing shortage of Developers, pay rates increasing, excellent climate and relatively low cost of living compared to other cities, Brisbane offers a great option if you are looking to further your career.

Our client, an award winning and one of Australia’s fastest growing companies is currently looking for a Front End Web Developer to join there high performing team in central Brisbane. The business has a great company culture, is young and dynamic and has a great leadership team.

Key aspects of the role include:

  • Being involved in the technical direction of front end technologies
  • Work with JavaScript frameworks to create scalable applications
  • Testing to ensure stability and reliability of applications
  • Create usable and performance driven UI components
  • Designing tools, such as style guides to ensure other developers can work on the application

To be considered for the role you will need to have the following experience:

  • At least 3 years working with JavaScript
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks and libraries e.g. ReactJS or Angular JS
  • Ideally have experience building responsive web applications
  • Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3, including pre-processors such as Sass or LESS
  • Can create workflows using tools like NPM and Gulp

This is a great opportunity to get involved with a fast growing and innovate company who have global ambitions and are disrupting the market they are currently operating in.

In addition to the above role we are also looking for talented Front End and Back End WordPress developers and are generally interested in speaking to any IT professionals who might be interested in working in Australia.

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90k - $100k + Bonus / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions / 55 Hours Monday - Friday

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Christchurch - $90,000 - $100,000 + Bonuses + Private Use Company Vehicle
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Our client is a highly successful Tier 2 building company that has a current requirement for a top class, Project Manager to join their Perth team for an upcoming project. This builder has nationwide presence, a young vibrant culture, and a terrific history of successfully completing a broad range of commercial building projects in the $10-50m range. We are seeking a Project Manager on the rise and ready to take the next step in their career. You will have a proven track record of managing commercial building projects valued around $30m for similar sized commercial builders. Your previous experience must include complete Design & Construct retail and commercial building projects of this size from pre-contract stage through procurement, site establishment, construction, fit-out and handover. 

Our client is interviewing currently so you must be available immediately or on a maximum of one month’s notice, to be considered for this superb permanent vacancy. This will be a tremendous long term career opportunity for a Project Manager seeking employment with a highly reputable and successful Tier 2 builder. This business has achieved significant growth in WA in the last few years despite the extremely competitive nature of the current tender market, which is indicative of a great leadership team and uinique construction methodologies. 

You will need the following qualifications, skills and experience to be considered for this tremendous position:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Project Management, Construction Management & Economics, Engineering or similar
  • 5-10 years’ recent experience as a Project Manager delivering various types of commercial building projects in Australia
  • Previous Design & Construct commercial/retail building experience for building companies valued CIRCA $30m
  • Stable work history that includes reputable Tier 1&2 commercial building contractors
  • High level programming skills in MS Project and commercially astute to manage costs and meet budget targets
  • Great interpersonal skills to manage client interaction and ability to lead a team
  • Strong existing network of subbies and contacts in the Perth metro region
  • Currently based in Perth or WA with existing rights to live and work in Australia

A terrific remuneration package of CIRCA $160-180K will be offered to attract the industry’s best Project Manager. Join this terrific company and look forward to outstanding career opportunities as they continue their expansion in WA.

JobListing.JobTitle: Intermediate - Senior Civil Engineer land and site
JobListing.ShortDescription: Intermediate to Senior Civil Engineer for Emerging Auckland Consultancy with focus on sub divisions
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
3 months into 2016 Civil Engineers stick or twist?
Somehow we have blinked and we are now 3 months into 2016, the year has started quickly and in all accounts is looking to be exciting, busy and very prosperous, or is it? Incidentally what is the view like in your office? If you’re reading this at work I can only assume it’s pretty bleak.
Stellar have been busy forging and strengthening relationships and really delving and uncovering the goals or our clients and are very happy to be supporting this emerging client in growing on its existing high performance and healthy work life balance.
With Long established rock solid reputation and growing success built around its existing team, growth is now the word and this company is looking to bring the right staff in to the fold. With openings for intermediate to Senior Engineers, career plans are waiting for the right candidate who feels they want to pursue and develop their career further in to the management field. Every avenue is covered from soft skill training to freedom to express yourself. If you have an eye on the future there can only be one course of action, get in touch today.

What you will need
• 5+years design experience
• New Zealand Experience
• Strong Sub division experience
• Ability to liaise with clients
• Ambition to grow and develop

What this company will give you
• Great company culture
• Guided career path
• Annual Bonus
• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. At stellar we really believe in partnership and strong relationships and that only comes from listening, and finding out what you want. The best way to see your dreams come true is to voice them, if you match the above criteria then please email adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 09 9691029 and lets change the years forecast together. Your cards may have been dealt but that doesn’t mean this will be your hand for life, the dealer is now looking at you, It’s your turn what will it be? Stick or twist?
 

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029

• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. JobListing.ShortDescription: Are you an experienced industrial electrician who is ready for a challange and enjoys being part of a great team? Than we want to hear from you!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
We are looking for a forward thinking and experienced Maintenance Electrician with a ‘can do’ attitude to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG companies. With business booming, we are looking for someone who can roll up their sleeves and is ready to get their hands dirty. In this role you play a key role in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. You will work in an efficient and timely manner, all the while demonstrating your commitment to safety.

This role will require you to have the ability to work as part of a team, as well as in a sole charge capacity and have impeccable time management skills. You must have a firm understanding of electrical equipment and practices, and you will have the desire to continuously develop yourself while working in an ever changing and fast paced environment.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Current NZ Electrical Registration

  • Experience in electrical maintenance in fixed plant environments

  • Knowledge ofSCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • A strong self-starter mentality with the ability to work in a team and a sole charge capacity

  • A flexible attitude towards to change and adjust well to unique environments

An attractive pay packet will be offered to the right person who shows commitment to the job, loyalty to the company and goes above and beyond to get the job done.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our specialist maintenance trade and electrical recruiter today.
